title: â€˜Culinary Class Warsâ€™ Season 2 Trailer Drops on Netflix Ahead of December Return
description: Netflix is gearing up for the Dec. 16 return of hit reality cooking competition â€œCulinary Class Warsâ€ with the release of its main trailer, as antic
body:
Netflix is gearing up for the Dec. 16 return of hit reality cooking competition â€œCulinary Class Warsâ€ with the release of its main trailer, as anticipation builds for the sophomore season of the unscripted series.

	The trailer launch comes as excitement mounts for the showâ€™s return. The format made history last year as the first Korean reality series to top Netflixâ€™s Global Top 10 (Non-English TV) list for three consecutive weeks. The show also earned recognition as â€œthe most beloved series among Korean viewersâ€ in Gallup Koreaâ€™s September 2024 survey.
	

	The first season was widely credited with revitalizing Seoulâ€™s dining scene, which saw increased restaurant bookings and renewed interest in the cityâ€™s culinary talent.


	Season 2 introduces new rules and heightened competition, including the return of two masked contestants seeking redemption. The format retains the signature blind tastings that became the showâ€™s calling card, with judges evaluating dishes purely on flavor to eliminate bias.

	The White Spoon lineup features two-Michelin-star chef Lee Jun and Son Jong-won, who holds one Michelin star each in Korean and Western cuisine. Venerable Sunjae brings expertise as Koreaâ€™s first master of Buddhist temple cuisine, while Hou Deok-juk contributes 57 years of Chinese cuisine experience and Park Hyo-nam offers 47 years in French cuisine. The roster also includes popular chefs Jung Ho-young, Sam Kim, Raymon Kim, MasterChef Korea Season 4 judge Song Hoon, and Hansik Battle Season 3 winner Im Seong-keun.

	The Black Spoons return with competitors bearing colorful monikers including â€œThree Star Killer,â€ â€œSeochon Prince,â€ â€œCulinary Monster,â€ and â€œBarbecue Lab Director.â€ Newcomers â€œCulinary Innovatorâ€ and â€œWok Riderâ€ promise to add fresh dynamics to the competition, with hints of unexpected alliances in store.
	

	The announcement comes as Korean drama â€œPhysical: Asiaâ€ continues to hold a spot in Netflixâ€™s Global Non-English Top 10 list for its third consecutive week.

	Watch the â€œCulinary Class Warsâ€ Season 2 trailer here:

schema.headline: â€˜Culinary Class Warsâ€™ Season 2 Trailer Drops on Netflix Ahead of December Return

title: Aubrey Oâ€™Day Says She Was Fired From Danity Kane for â€˜Not Participating Sexuallyâ€™ With Diddy; Struggles to Recall Alleged Assault: â€˜I Donâ€™t Even Know if I Was Raped and I Donâ€™t Want to Knowâ€™
description:
SPOILER ALERT:Â This post contains spoilers from â€œSean Combs: The Reckoning,â€ now streaming on Netflix.

	Aubrey Oâ€™Day, who was picked to be in Sean
body:
SPOILER ALERT:Â This post contains spoilers from â€œSean Combs: The Reckoning,â€ now streaming on Netflix.

	Aubrey Oâ€™Day, who was picked to be in Sean â€œDiddyâ€ Combsâ€™ girl group Danity Kane during the third season of â€œMaking the Band,â€ has joined the voices speaking about the rap mogulâ€™s alleged pattern of abuse during his time in the music industry in the just-released Netflix docuseries â€œSean Combs: The Reckoning.â€


	Oâ€™Day began telling her story by saying how she was treated as a member of the Danity Kane. â€œDiddy made it clear that I was â€˜the looker,'â€ Oâ€™Day said. â€œI remember that phrase a lot. He was separating me and there was a different set of expectations from me, and I just naturally float into the grooming.â€
	

	When asked when she thought her collaboration with Combs â€œcrossed the line of becoming sexual,â€ Oâ€™Day said, â€œThere are emails with pictures of his penis.â€ She read one of his emails out loud, which included passages like, â€œâ€˜I donâ€™t wanna just fuck you. I wanna turn you out. I can see you being with some motherfucker that you tell what to do. I make my woman do what I tell her to do, and she loves it. I just want â€” and like â€” to do things different. Iâ€™mma finish watching this porn and finish masturbating. Iâ€™ll think of you, happy face. If you change your mind and get ready to do what I say, hit me. Happy face. God bless, Diddy. God is the greatest.â€™

	â€œThis is your boss at your work sending you that e-mail,â€ she continued. â€œWhat happens in real life to anyone else? Your boss gets fired. Six months later, I was fired. I absolutely felt that I was fired for not participating sexually, but I also found out later that [fellow Danity Kane member] Dawn [Richard] and Puff were recording a different project. I was the star of the show, and Puff needed to move that entire audience over to a new project.â€
	

	When asked about individual accusations in â€œSean Combs: The Reckoning,â€ Combsâ€™ legal counsel sent a statement to Variety, writing, â€œWeâ€™re not going to comment on individual claims being repeated in the documentary. Many of the people featured have longstanding personal grievances, financial motives, or credibility issues that have been documented for years. Several of these stories have already been addressed in court filings, and others were never raised in any legal forum because theyâ€™re simply not true. The project was built around a one-sided narrative led by a publicly admitted adversary, and it repeats allegations without context, evidence, or verification Sean Combs will continue to address legitimate matters through the legal process, not through a biased Netflix production.â€ When asked specifically about Oâ€™Dayâ€™s allegations in the docuseries, a representative for Combs did not immediately respond to a request for comment. Combsâ€™ team also released a longer statement about the project overall here.

	Later in the series, Oâ€™Day said she was informed of an affidavit that was received during the flood of civil lawsuits filed against Combs. In it, a woman alleges that she accidentally walked into a room where Oâ€™Day was â€œsprawled out on a leather couch, looking very inebriated. She was naked from the bottom half, and she had something over her top. Puff Daddy was penetrating in her vagina, and there was another stalky light-skinned man with his penis in her mouth.â€

	After reading the affidavit on camera, Oâ€™Day said she is conflicted because, â€œI didnâ€™t have a recollection of this.â€ She also stated that â€œI didnâ€™t drink like that at all â€”Â I donâ€™t drink at all, itâ€™s never been an issue with me.â€

	â€œDoes this mean I was raped?â€ Oâ€™Day asked. â€œIs that what this means? I donâ€™t even know if I was raped, and I donâ€™t want to know. I donâ€™t want to find out any more that that woman has to say. If she made it up, I would be compelled to take her the fuck down. You realize the burden that that puts on my soul for the past year, which is if I expose one victim whoâ€™s got a civil lawsuit, that gives Diddy and his legal team credit to take down everybody else as potential liars. Says Aubrey Oâ€™Day! It goes right back on my shoulders, just like that. The weight of that man and his bullshit â€¦ I will never get up from under it.â€

schema.headline: Aubrey Oâ€™Day Says She Was Fired From Danity Kane for â€˜Not Participating Sexuallyâ€™ With Diddy; Struggles to Recall Alleged Assault: â€˜I Donâ€™t Even Know if I Was Raped and I Donâ€™t Want to Knowâ€™

title: â€˜Tehranâ€™ Breakout Star Raz Yuvan Plays a Young Police Investigator in Keshetâ€™s New Crime Thriller â€˜Murder at the Dead Seaâ€™ From â€˜Red Skiesâ€™ Producer (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Niv Sultan, the breakout star of â€œTehran,â€ leads the cast of a new crime thriller, â€œMurder at the Dead Sea,â€ which is produced by Yoav Gross Product
body:
Niv Sultan, the breakout star of â€œTehran,â€ leads the cast of a new crime thriller, â€œMurder at the Dead Sea,â€ which is produced by Yoav Gross Productions, the banner behind â€œNutuk,â€ â€œRed Skiesâ€ and â€œManayek.â€ 

	Keshet International has boarded worldwide sales on the seven-part show and will introduce it to buyers at the London TV Screenings on Feb. 24. Currently in post-production and set to premiere on Keshet 12 on Dec. 22, â€œMurder at the Dead Seaâ€ is created by Raz Yuvan (â€œKfula,â€ â€œHezi and Sonsâ€), directed by Tomer Shani (â€œCarthargo,â€ â€œNehamaâ€). 
	

	Set against Israelâ€™s Dead Sea, â€œMurder at the Dead Seaâ€ opens with the mysterious death of Sarah Hacohen, a pop icon whose body plummets from the ninth floor of a quarantined hotel during the height of the pandemic. What begins as an apparent suicide quickly unravels into a dark web of deceit, betrayal, and murder. Trapped in isolation, young police investigator Revi Shem-Tov (Sultan) must uncover the truth among a group of quarantined strangersâ€”each hiding secrets more dangerous than the virus itself.


	â€œâ€˜Murder at the Dead Seaâ€™ is a high-end thriller that reinvents the locked-room mystery for todayâ€™s global audience,â€ said Kelly Wright, Keshet Internationalâ€™s managing director of distribution. â€œIt features a stunning and exotic location, twisty plot, and an outstanding performance from Niv Sultan.â€ 

	Karni Ziv, Keshet 12â€™s head of drama and comedy, adds: â€œWe think Keshet 12 viewers are going to love this contemporary reimagining of the classic Agatha Christie whodunnit set in a COVID hotel by the Dead Sea, because it combines the taut suspense of â€˜And Then There Were Noneâ€™ with the cinematic storytelling of â€˜The White Lotus.'â€
	

	Recent scripted commissions by Keshet 12 include the October 7 drama, â€œRed Alertâ€ which ranks as Israelâ€™s highest-rated drama of the last decade; â€œNutuk,â€ a gripping suspense drama where a boyâ€™s memories of another life lead two families into the heart of a buried murder mystery; and â€œSave the Date,â€ a romantic comedy starring Tomer Capone.

schema.headline: â€˜Tehranâ€™ Breakout Star Raz Yuvan Plays a Young Police Investigator in Keshetâ€™s New Crime Thriller â€˜Murder at the Dead Seaâ€™ From â€˜Red Skiesâ€™ Producer (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Indonesian Filmmaker Garin Nugroho Elevated to Higher Rank in Franceâ€™s Arts Honor
description: Acclaimed Indonesian filmmaker Garin Nugroho has been elevated to the rank of Officier dans lâ€™Ordre des Arts et des Lettres by Franceâ€˜s Ministry of
body:
Acclaimed Indonesian filmmaker Garin Nugroho has been elevated to the rank of Officier dans lâ€™Ordre des Arts et des Lettres by Franceâ€˜s Ministry of Culture, receiving one of the countryâ€™s highest cultural distinctions in recognition of his contributions to cinema.

	French Ambassador to Indonesia, Timor-Leste and ASEAN, Fabien Penone, presented the decoration to Nugroho during the JAFF Market French Night at the Institut franÃ§ais dâ€™IndonÃ©sie in Yogyakarta. The filmmaker had previously been named Chevalier in the order in 2015.
	

	Established in 1957, the Order of Arts and Letters honors individuals who have made exceptional contributions to culture in France and globally. The elevation acknowledges Nugrohoâ€™s decades-long career shaping Indonesian cinema and expanding its international presence.


	Nugroho made history in 1998 when his film â€œDaun di Atas Bantalâ€ became the first Indonesian feature selected for the Cannes Film Festival, screening in the Un Certain Regard section. The milestone opened doors for Indonesian cinema in France and internationally.

	His work has maintained strong resonance with French audiences and institutions. â€œMemories of My Bodyâ€ won the MontgolfiÃ¨re dâ€™Or at the Festival des 3 Continents in Nantes in 2018. In 2023, the MusÃ©e du Quai Branly â€“ Jacques Chirac hosted a presentation of â€œSetan Jawaâ€ as a large-scale cine-concert featuring symphonic orchestra and gamelan ensemble.

	The collaboration continues with â€œDaun di Atas Bantalâ€ set to open the Panorama of Indonesian Cinema event at the CinÃ©mathÃ¨que franÃ§aise in Paris on Dec. 10. The major retrospective will showcase several decades of Indonesian filmmaking and bring prominent Indonesian directors to the French capital.
	

	Nugrohoâ€™s latest film, â€œSamsaraâ€ (2024), blends cinema, live music, Balinese tradition and contemporary forms. The hybrid work earned four Citra Awards in 2024, including best director, cinematography, music and production design.

	Beyond filmmaking, Nugroho founded the Jogja-Netpac Asian Film Festival (JAFF), Indonesiaâ€™s leading independent film festival. He launched the JAFF Market in 2024 as the festivalâ€™s first film industry platform. His collaboration with France has facilitated initiatives including the Indonesia-France Film Lab, which pairs emerging Indonesian filmmakers with French industry professionals for mentorship.

	Since 2023, Nugroho has served as head of cultural programming at GIK UGM, where he develops projects connecting culture with education, creation and public engagement, often in partnership with the French Embassy.

	â€œGarin Nugrohoâ€™s cinematic work as well as his leadership within Indonesiaâ€™s cultural landscape, have made him one of the most influential figures of Southeast Asian cinema,â€ said Penone. â€œThanks to his deep engagement with France, he has strengthened the ties between our film communities and reinforced the cultural cooperation between our two countries.â€

	Nugrohoâ€™s debut feature, â€œCinta dalam Sepotong Roti,â€ was released in 1990.

schema.headline: Indonesian Filmmaker Garin Nugroho Elevated to Higher Rank in Franceâ€™s Arts Honor

title: â€˜Heated Rivalryâ€™ Creator Shuts Down Question About Actorsâ€™ Sexuality: â€˜I Donâ€™t Think Thereâ€™s Any Reason to Get into That Stuffâ€™
description: â€œHeated Rivalryâ€ creator Jacob Tierney said during a recent interview with Xtra that the real-life sexualities of his stars are irrelevant compared
body:
â€œHeated Rivalryâ€ creator Jacob Tierney said during a recent interview with Xtra that the real-life sexualities of his stars are irrelevant compared to the â€œenthusiasm and willingnessâ€ they bring to HBOâ€™s new queer, sports drama series.

	â€œI donâ€™t think thereâ€™s any reason to get into that stuff,â€ Tierney said when asked if the sexualities of stars Hudson Williams and Connor Storrie are relevant to the show. â€œIâ€™ll tell you something about the casting of both of these roles. You canâ€™t ask questions like that when youâ€™re casting, right? Itâ€™s actually against the law. So what you have to gauge is somebodyâ€™s enthusiasm and willingness to do the work.â€
	

	He added, â€œAnd thatâ€™s whatâ€™s so impressive about both of these guys is they came into this being like, â€˜Yeah, weâ€™re here to do this, and we are here to make this story feel authentic and to be as real as possible.â€™ And they fucking hit it out of the park.â€


	â€œHeated Rivalryâ€ stars Williams and Storrie as emerging hockey pros Shane Hollander and Ilya Rozanov, respectively. Despite playing for rival teams, the pair develops a romance off the ice.

	Williams recently told Out Magazine that his chemistry with Storrie has an intense and unexpected authenticity unrivaled by other potential co-stars.

	â€œI read with one other possible Ilya, and it was good. But something about Connor,â€ he said. â€œThere was an inexplicable X-factor that just felt realer than what I thought it could possibly be. And that was something. I had a quote I told Jacob, at one point, about my read with Connor in particular.â€
	

	In the same interview, Tierney recalled meeting with Williams after the fact: â€œHudson told me, â€˜The other guy was good, but Connor felt like he was going to pin me down and fuck me,â€™â€ later adding, â€œThat is literally what he said. And I was like, â€˜Well, I think I cast this right.â€™â€

schema.headline: â€˜Heated Rivalryâ€™ Creator Shuts Down Question About Actorsâ€™ Sexuality: â€˜I Donâ€™t Think Thereâ€™s Any Reason to Get into That Stuffâ€™

title: â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€™ First Reactions Call James Cameronâ€™s Third Chapter an â€˜Ultimate Cinematic Spectacleâ€™ That â€˜Pushes Technical Boundaries in Unimaginable Waysâ€™
description: James Cameronâ€˜s â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ has finally been unveiled to members of the film press ahead of its theatrical rollout later this month, and
body:
James Cameronâ€˜s â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ has finally been unveiled to members of the film press ahead of its theatrical rollout later this month, and journalists are calling the third trip to Pandora an â€œultimate cinematic spectacleâ€ that pushes â€œvisuals and emotion to new heights.â€

	Film critic Courtney Howard praised the film on X, writing that films like â€œFire and Ashâ€ remind us what â€œmovie theaters were built for.â€


	â€œ3 films in, James Cameron still has the sauce, making the epic spectacular feel emotionally impactful,â€ Howard wrote. â€œA glorious saga. Bold, brilliant & awesome in every way, this is what movie theaters were built for.â€
	

	Fellow critic Sean Tajipour echoed the praise on X. He wrote that with â€œFire and Ash,â€ Cameron â€œcontinues to push boundaries with every frame.â€ 

	â€œI may not be the biggest â€˜Avatarâ€™ superfan, but [â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€˜] proves once again that James Cameron can and will always deliver the ultimate cinematic spectacle, pushing visuals and emotion to new heights and redefining what a true blockbuster feels like,â€ he wrote. â€œItâ€™s bold, immersive, unforgettable, and driven by sheer ambition.â€

	Collider correspondent Perri Nemiroff wrote of the film on X, â€œThree films in and I still canâ€™t get over how magical the [â€˜Avatarâ€™] movies are. Wish I had more original phrasing, but this applies too well â€” [â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€™] truly feels like a ride. I couldnâ€™t believe how quickly I was pulled back into the world of Pandora and swept up in the situation. And once that happens, thereâ€™s a noticeable increase in complexity in quite a few aspects of the production.â€ 
	

	Film writer Michael Lee wrote on X that the story left a bit to be desired, but praised the visuals and action as â€œout-of-this-world.â€ 

	He wrote, â€œ[â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€™] is huge on visual spectacle, especially in 3D. Deeper exploration of Pandora & new tribes allow for immense world-building. Story may be lacking, but this pushes technical boundaries in unimaginable ways.â€

	â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ picks up after the events of 2022â€™s â€œAvatar: The Way of Water,â€ which notably ended with the death of Jake Sully and Neytiriâ€™s son Neteyam. This latest installment finds the Sully family grieving one of their own when a new threat emerges in the form of the Fire tribe, an antagonistic group of Naâ€™viÂ volcano-dwellers led by the revengeful Varang (Oona Chaplin in her franchise debut). The returning cast includes Sam Worthington, Zoe SaldaÃ±a, Sigourney Weaver, Stephen Lang and Kate Winslet, among others.

	Cameron has been blunt in recent interviews in saying the future of the â€œAvatarâ€ franchise depends on the box office performance of â€œFire and Ashâ€ this holiday movie season. The director originally envisioned five â€œAvatarâ€ movies and has a large chunk of a fourth movie already shot. The original â€œAvatarâ€ remains the highest-grossing movie of all time (unadjusted for inflation) with $2.9 billion worldwide, while â€œThe Way of Waterâ€ is third on the list with $2.3 billion. Cameron told Empire magazineÂ earlier this year that heâ€™s ready to direct the fourth movie himself.

	â€œI mean, thereâ€™s no reason not to,â€ Cameron said ahead of his 71st birthday in August about directing more â€œAvatarâ€ sequels himself. â€œIâ€™m healthy, Iâ€™m good to go. Iâ€™m not going to rule it out. I mean, Iâ€™ve got to make it in a vigorous way, to handle the kind of volume and energy of the work for another six or seven years. You know what I mean? I might not be able to do thatâ€¦ [but] if I can, Iâ€™ll just do it.â€

	â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ opens in theaters Dec. 19. Check out more first reactions below. 

James Cameron did it again! â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€™ is jaw dropping from start to finish and easily one of the most visually stunning films to hit theaters in years. Iâ€™ve never felt so immersed in a world like this. #AvatarFireAndAsh pic.twitter.com/BaNqtaDMXxâ€” Dorian Parks (@DorianParksnRec) December 2, 2025


#AvatarFireAndAsh is a visual masterpiece. If you love these movies, it's more of the same, but story-wise, it's the same "capture/rescue" plot over and over again with some laughable dialogue thrown in the middle. The runtime is criminal, and if you have eye issues, avoid the 3D pic.twitter.com/p8ou1mI25câ€” Kaitlyn Booth (@katiesmovies) December 2, 2025


#AvatarFireAndAsh James Cameron once again deliver a remarkable visual feast. The fire tribe are a scene stealing presence. Oona Chaplinâ€™s dynamic w/ Quaritch was a highlight. I will say Way of Water spoiled us w/ SO MUCH new stuff this one feels slightly repetitive w/ little new pic.twitter.com/9O4JQ9DKN5â€” Cris Parker (@3CFilmss) December 2, 2025


We all thought James Cameron was making his Star Wars, #AvatarFireAndAsh cements it as his Pirates of the Caribbean trilogy (highly complimentary). This is so At World's End coded & Cameron has fully embraced the anime & video game inspos even more proudly here. A nonstop seriesâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/pDOQNgaEKzâ€” Griffin Schiller (@griffschiller) December 2, 2025


#AvatarFireandAsh is a visual masterpiece & the fight scenes are breathtaking. Zoe Saldana & Oona Chaplin are standouts. There were captivating moments with themes of grief & faith. But the script becomes lazy, repetitive & exhausting with excruciatingly bad dialogue. #Avatar2 pic.twitter.com/7RxTBjQVxeâ€” sagesurge (@sagesurge) December 2, 2025


The best and unexpectedly, the horniest of the three, #AvatarFireAndAsh features some astonishing filmmaking from James Cameron. Fans of the previous two will be very pleased.â€” Todd Gilchrist (@mtgilchrist) December 2, 2025


#AvatarFireAndAsh felt like coming home. old dog james cameron isnâ€™t demonstrating many new tricks but i literally do not care â€” repetition is allowed when itâ€™s perfecting the beats of past movies with jaw dropping spectacle and darker, strife-rich storytelling. my family!!!! pic.twitter.com/Oaa5YVP7jPâ€” lyvie scott (@lyviescott) December 2, 2025


#AvatarFireAndAsh Â is a staggering achievement of moviemaking, and an all round phenomenal film. James Cameron raises the stakes. Itâ€™s bigger, better and more emotional than ever before. It has gorgeous visuals, thrilling new characters and is a technical marvel. Loved it. pic.twitter.com/XcPKjCvsVLâ€” Jazz Tangcay (@jazzt) December 2, 2025

schema.headline: â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€™ First Reactions Call James Cameronâ€™s Third Chapter an â€˜Ultimate Cinematic Spectacleâ€™ That â€˜Pushes Technical Boundaries in Unimaginable Waysâ€™

title: Reza Rahadian, Dian Sastrowardoyo Lead Yosep Anggi Noenâ€™s â€˜The Sea Speaks His Nameâ€™
description: Indonesian director Yosep Anggi Noen (â€œThe Redemption of Sinâ€) is bringing Leila S. Chudoriâ€™s acclaimed novel The Sea Speaks His Nameâ€ (Laut Berceri
body:
Indonesian director Yosep Anggi Noen (â€œThe Redemption of Sinâ€) is bringing Leila S. Chudoriâ€™s acclaimed novel The Sea Speaks His Nameâ€ (Laut Bercerita) to the screen. 

	The ensemble cast features Reza Rahadian, Dian Sastrowardoyo, Yunita Siregar, Eva Celia, Christine Hakim and Arswendy Beningswara.

	The film, unveiled at the JAFF Market, is currently in production through PAL8 Pictures in cooperation with VMS Studio, Jagartha, Lynx Films and Brandlink, centers on the Wibisono family whose eldest son, Biru Laut, vanishes during the 1990s. While parents Arya Wibisono and his wife maintain hope their son survives, daughter Asmara Jati becomes convinced her brother is gone.
	

	Set against Indonesiaâ€™s democracy movement of the 1990s, the narrative follows university student Biru Laut, whose commitment to justice leads him into the Winatra group, a secret circle of activists writing and speaking in defiance of authoritarian rule. The story unfolds through dual perspectives: Lautâ€™s own voice, characterized by poetry and idealism, and his sister Asmara Jatiâ€™s later search for traces of her disappeared brother among families still waiting for answers.


	â€œThis is not a conventional love story â€“ it is a narrative of young people holding onto their principles, to speak of their voices,â€ Noen said. The filmmaker emphasized that resistance transcends time, belonging to all generations.

	Noen is adapting source material that has been reprinted over 120 times, with approximately 700,000 book copies sold and an expected readership of 1.4 million. The production will incorporate period visual markers including demonstrations, mass movements and underground meetings set against popular music of the era, along with fashion, communication technology and entertainment icons designed to emphasize parallels with contemporary youth.
	

	â€œIn a world where history is buried beneath misinformation, propaganda, and digital echo chambers, fiction becomes essential,â€ Noen noted, describing the approach as extracting real events and reconstructing them to ignite curiosity.

	Behind the camera, the production team includes producer Gita Fara, co-scriptwriters Chudori and Noen, cinematographer Batara Goempar, production designer Ahmad Zulkarnaen, editor Dinda Amanda, costume designer Retno Ratih Damayanti and makeup designer Aktris Handrajasa.

	PAL8 Pictures, a production house under Tempo Media Group with over 50 years in the press industry, is making its feature debut with the project before moving forward with additional titles. The company aims to produce films relevant to societal issues, including stories with social or historical backgrounds.

	Co-producers include VMS (Visual Media Studio), known for titles including â€œPemandu Jenazah,â€ â€œAssalamualaikum Baitullah,â€ â€œMaryam: Janji dan Jiwa yang Terikatâ€ and â€œPenerbangan Terakhirâ€; Jagartha Group, recognized as a pioneer in film financing in Indonesia with credits including â€œMencuri Raden Saleh,â€ â€œJatuh Cinta Seperti di Film-Film,â€ â€œAgak Laenâ€ and â€œSore: Istri dari Masa Depanâ€; and Lynx Films, founded in 2004 and known for collaborations with director Garin Nugroho on â€œSamsara,â€ with recent short films â€œPulangâ€ and â€œGalura Tropikalia Aliveâ€ selected as entries at this yearâ€™s Jogja-Netpac Asian Film Festival.

	The production is targeting a third quarter 2026 release.

schema.headline: Reza Rahadian, Dian Sastrowardoyo Lead Yosep Anggi Noenâ€™s â€˜The Sea Speaks His Nameâ€™

title: Jon Stewart Slams Trumpâ€™s Immigration Crackdown in Wake of National Guard Shooting: â€˜He Does Not View You as Individualsâ€™
description: On this weekâ€™s episode of â€œThe Daily Show,â€ Jon Stewart went after Donald Trump for enacting sweeping immigration reform after an Afghan national wa
body:
On this weekâ€™s episode of â€œThe Daily Show,â€ Jon Stewart went after Donald Trump for enacting sweeping immigration reform after an Afghan national was accused of shooting two National Guard members on Nov. 26 in Washington, DC.

	As a result, the United States halted immigration from Afghanistan. Trump also said he would reassess green cards for immigrants living in the United States from 19 countries.


	â€œThat horrible act was done by one individual who was part of a larger group of Afghans who were brought here because they risked their lives helping the United States during our invasion of Afghanistan,â€ Stewart said. â€œWhich, of course, meansâ€¦â€
	

	Stewart then cut to a clip of Trump speaking to reporters about his decision to pause asylum requests. The president said the suspected shooter is part of a group of â€œpeople that shouldnâ€™t be in our country,â€ a cluster that also includes â€œSomaliansâ€ and â€œplenty of others.â€

	â€œDid you just â€˜Somaliaâ€™ Afghanistan?â€ Stewart joked. â€œBecause of this one Afghan, all Afghans are suspect, and also Somalians?â€

	The late-night pundit then cut to another clip of Trump at Mar-a-Lago, where he was asked what the Solamians had to do with the National Guard shooting. The president replied, â€œNothing, but Somalians have caused a lot of trouble.â€

	â€œâ€˜They had nothing to do with it, just reminded me of other groups I also donâ€™t like. I donâ€™t see color. I just hate all of it,'â€ Stewart said. â€œSo our entire immigration system is now going to be based around the principle that if even one person from your ethnic or religious group fucked up, you all got to go.â€
	

	Later in the monologue, Stewart asked who Trump would like to see come to America. Trumpâ€™s answer came in a sound bite: â€œI also like very competent people coming into our country. â€¦ MaÃ®tre ds, wine experts, even waiters, high-quality waiters. You got to get the best people.â€

	â€œSo Somalians arenâ€™t welcome, unless theyâ€™re also â€˜sommeliers,'â€ Stewart said. â€œBut by the way, I want to make this clear. I donâ€™t mind Trump having strict standards. The problem is, if you are from the so-called less desirable countries, he does not view you as individuals. You are just part of a larger amorphous blob of suspicion that deserves no grace, and if one of you fuck up, all are condemned.â€

	Watch the entire monologue below.

schema.headline: Jon Stewart Slams Trumpâ€™s Immigration Crackdown in Wake of National Guard Shooting: â€˜He Does Not View You as Individualsâ€™

title: Taylor Swift Releases Official Trailer for â€˜Eras Tour: The Final Showâ€™ Concert Film
description: Taylor Swift has released the official trailer for her upcoming Disney+ special â€œTaylor Swift | The Eras Tour | The Final Show,â€ releasing on Decemb
body:
Taylor Swift has released the official trailer for her upcoming Disney+ special â€œTaylor Swift | The Eras Tour | The Final Show,â€ releasing on December 12.

	The film will be a full concert experience captured during the final show of her tour in Vancouver, B.C., featuring the entire set of â€œThe Tortured Poets Departmentâ€ for the first time. That portion of the show was added to the tour following the albumâ€™s release in April 2024. Fans were able to watch an earlier iteration of the â€œEras Tourâ€ theatrical film on Disney+ before those songs were added to the tour set list.
	

	â€œWeâ€™ve had so long to prepare for the end of this tour and we get to play one last show for you here tonight,â€ says Swift in the trailer, which shows her performing â€œLong Live.â€ â€œI want to thank every single one of you for being a part of the most thrilling chapter of my entire life to date.â€


	In addition to the release of â€œThe Final Show,â€ Swift is planning to drop the first two episodes of her six-part docuseries â€œTaylor Swift | The Eras Tour | The End of an Era,â€ also on December 12. That series has been described as â€œan intimate look at Taylorâ€™s life as her tour made headlines and thrilled fans around the world.â€ Opening tour acts, including Gracie Abrams and Sabrina Carpenter, will appear in the series, as will guests Ed Sheeran and Florence Welch. Following the first episode releases, two additional batches of two episodes will be released in the following weeks.

	â€œTaylor Swift | The Eras Tour | The End of an Eraâ€ is directed by Don Argott, co-directed by Sheena M. Joyce and produced by Object & Animal. â€œTaylor Swift | The Eras Tour | The Final Show,â€ meanwhile, is directed by Glenn Weiss and produced by Taylor Swift Productions in association with Silent House Productions.
	

	Watch the official trailer below:

schema.headline: Taylor Swift Releases Official Trailer for â€˜Eras Tour: The Final Showâ€™ Concert Film

title: â€˜Peepli Liveâ€™ Director Anusha Rizvi Returns With Family Comedy â€˜The Great Shamsuddin Familyâ€™ for JioHotstar (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Indian filmmaker Anusha Rizvi, director of the acclaimed â€œPeepli Live,â€ is returning to feature filmmaking with â€œThe Great Shamsuddin Family,â€ a com
body:
Indian filmmaker Anusha Rizvi, director of the acclaimed â€œPeepli Live,â€ is returning to feature filmmaking with â€œThe Great Shamsuddin Family,â€ a comedy-drama that examines modern Indian family dynamics.

	The film stars Kritika Kamra as Bani Ahmed, a writer racing against a career-defining 12-hour deadline when her home becomes ground zero for a family crisis. The ensemble cast includes Purab Kohli, Farida Jalal, Shreya Dhanwanthary, Juhi Babbar, Sheeba Chaddha, Dolly Ahluwalia, Natasha Rastogi and Nishank Verma.
	

	Set over one day in Delhi, the narrative follows Bani as mothers, aunts, cousins and former romantic interests descend on her apartment, each bringing their own emergencies. As the protagonist navigates interfaith complexities, generational conflicts and family expectations, she faces a choice between pursuing international career opportunities or remaining with her family.


	â€œAt its core, the film isnâ€™t just about interruptions; itâ€™s about how family even at its most exasperating shapes us in ways we canâ€™t escape,â€ Rizvi said. â€œThrough Baniâ€™s day of glorious madness, I hope audiences recognize glimpses of their own mothers, aunts, siblings, and that one relative who always shows up at the wrong moment but with the right heart.â€

	Kamra described her character as the quintessential eldest daughter in a middle-income family who prioritizes othersâ€™ needs over her own ambitions. â€œSheâ€™s quietly dependable, endlessly responsible, and always putting herself last, even when all she wants is a single day to focus on her own future,â€ the actor said.

	For Dhanwanthary, the project marked a departure from recent roles. â€œThis is my first time doing comedy after a run of serious, heavy-handed dramatic roles,â€ she said, noting she plays the impulsive younger sister who turns to her sibling during crises.
	

	Chaddha emphasized the filmâ€™s single-location setting. â€œEverything, the humor, the conflicts, the emotions unfolds under one roof, creating a world thatâ€™s both intimate and wildly entertaining,â€ she said.

	Kohli called the production a mirror reflecting typical Indian family dynamics. â€œThatâ€™s exactly what makes it so relatable and so warm,â€ he said.

	â€œThe Great Shamsuddin Familyâ€ premieres Dec. 12 on JioHotstar, Indiaâ€™s largest streamer.

schema.headline: â€˜Peepli Liveâ€™ Director Anusha Rizvi Returns With Family Comedy â€˜The Great Shamsuddin Familyâ€™ for JioHotstar (EXCLUSIVE)

          Steve Irwin's son just won "Dancing with the Stars" Season 34, and he's got a smoking hot rumored girlfriend in actress Xochitl Gomez ... but forget all that, right now we're focusing on his hottest photos over the years as we celebrate his birthday.

TMZ Sports Live Stream
                          Join The Conversation!!!
                      
                  
                        Published December 1, 2025 12:56 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          TMZ Sports is going live from the newsroom to discuss the day's biggest stories ... but we don't just want folks to watch and enjoy the conversation, we want y'all to get involved!!
      
    
          Hit the comment section as Babcock, Lucas, Luca and the whole crew break down the most important topics of the day ... and we'll be interacting with viewers throughout the program between 1 and 2 PM PT.
      
    
          So tune in, make fun of us, share your two cents, sound off about your favorite team ... nothing is out of bounds.
      
    
          Monday's show will feature Lane Kiffin's dramatic exit at Ole Miss, a boxing legend's praise for Jake Paul, Klay Thompson's major shoutout to his girlfriend, Megan Thee Stallion, and much more!!
